str2: Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
This; he, she, it.
To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cut around, circumcise. From peri and the base of tomoteros; to cut around, i.e. to circumcise.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
That, that one there, yonder. From ekei; that one (neuter) thing); often intensified by the article prefixed.
Apparently a primary word; a spot, i.e. Location; figuratively, condition, opportunity; specially, a scabbard.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To know, remember, appreciate.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
From Hellas; a Hellen or inhabitant of Hellas; by extension a Greek-speaking person, especially a non-Jew.
